page.title: 18Religion _ Welsh Cong.
page.content: The two nonconformist chapels with the largest membership are Bethania and Bethesda, both are Welsh Congregationalist (Annibynwyr in Welsh). Bethania is in Upper Tumble and is the Mother Chapel of Bethesda which is in Lower Tumble. The first communion was held in Bethania on 7.9.1800. With so many of the membership coming from the lower part of Tumble it was decided to erect a building for them in 1888. This building is now the Vestry of Bethesda Chapel which was opened in 1905. Since that date Bethesda (406) has nearly twice the membership of Bethania (278). The joint membership of both chapels far outweigh the memberships of all the other nonconformist chapels and St. David's Church. All the services and Sunday School in both chapels are conducted in Welsh.
